article.title: Causality and existence of solutions of relativistic viscous fluid dynamics with gravity

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red line in Figure 1 represent?
choices: A spacelike curve
A future directed timelike curve
A past directed timelike curve
A Cauchy surface

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 2 illustrate about the large τ expansion in Bjorken flow?
choices: The series coefficients converge for large n.
The series coefficients diverge as fn ∼ n! for large n.
The series coefficients are independent of η/s.
The series coefficients are independent of χ.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which curve in Figure 3 represents the hydrodynamic attractor solution?
choices: The black dashed line
The solid red line
The purple dotted-dashed curve
The dotted blue line

multiple_choice_question.text: Which curve in Figure 4 demonstrates the pathology of negative temperatures in the NS solution for Gubser flow?
choices: The red line
The blue dotted-dashed line
The black dashed line
None of the above

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 5 illustrate about the fluid behavior in Gubser flow?
choices: The fluid only expands in the z-direction.
The fluid expands only in the transverse direction.
The fluid expands in both the transverse and longitudinal directions.
The fluid temperature decreases uniformly in all directions.

multiple_choice_question.text: What are the dynamic variables in Formula (4)?
choices: T, uµ, A, Qµ, πµν
η, χ, λ, σµν
, uµ
E, Π, uµ, πµν
The coefficients for the attractor solution in Bjorken flow
The coefficients for the gradient expansion series around equilibrium in Bjorken flow
The linearized perturbation equations for sound and shear modes
The non-relativistic limit of the conformal fluid
The exact solution for Gubser flow in the IS theory limit.
The exact solution for Gubser flow in the NS limit.
The full nonlinear partial differential equation for T in Gubser flow.
The linearized stability equations for Gubser flow.
